news_headline: GTA maker Take-Two to buy FarmVille creator Zynga in a $12.7 billion deal
news_article: Take-Two Interactive, the video game maker behind Grand Theft Auto, will acquire mobile gaming company Zynga in a cash-and-stock deal worth nearly $12.7 billion. Take-Two will acquire all outstanding shares of Zynga at a 64% premium to the company's closing price on Friday. Shares of FarmVille maker Zynga rose about 50% in US pre-market trading after the announcement.

news_headline: Smart door with motion-activated lighting & smart lock unveiled by US firm
news_article: US-based company Masonite has unveiled its 'M-Pwr' smart door which comes with motion-activated lighting, a built-in Ring doorbell camera and a smart door lock. The door connects to a home's electrical system and Wi-Fi network and can keep working for 24 hours in case of a power outage. All the items in the smart door are upgradable with evolving technology.

news_headline: Binance CEO richer than Mukesh Ambani with $96 billion wealth: Bloomberg
news_article: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao is the world's richest cryptocurrency entrepreneur with $96 billion wealth, Bloomberg said after estimating his net worth for the first time. It added that the 44-year-old is richer than Asia's richest person Mukesh Ambani, whose current net worth is $92.9 billion. Zhao is a former McDonald's employee and software developer.

news_headline: Apple App Store developers earn $60 billion in 'new yearly record'
news_article: iPhone maker Apple said that it has now paid over $260 billion to app developers since the App Store first launched in 2008, up from the $200 billion Apple reported at the end of 2020. This means that in 2021 alone, Apple paid developers $60 billion. The number set a "new yearly record" for App Store developer earnings, Apple added.

news_headline: WhatsApp Co-founder Brian Acton named WhatsApp rival Signal's interim CEO
news_article: WhatsApp Co-founder Brian Acton will act as the interim CEO of WhatsApp's rival app Signal after its Founder and CEO Moxie Marlinspike will step down from his position. "It's a new year, and I've decided it's a good time to replace myself as the CEO," Marlinspike said announcing his decision. However, Marlinspike will remain on Signal's board.

news_headline: Meta mandates booster shots for US staff, delays office reopening
news_article: Facebook-parent Meta has delayed its US office reopening date and mandated COVID-19 booster shots for employees returning to office. The reopening date has been delayed to March 28 from January 31. Employees have until March 14 to opt for return to the office. "Employees who take no action can face disciplinary measures, including termination," a Meta spokesperson said.

news_headline: Google accuses Apple of 'bullying' with its blue and green iMessage bubbles
news_article: Google accused Apple of profiting from "bullying" after a WSJ report pointed out that some youngsters feel the social pressure to own iPhones to use iMessage. When iPhone users exchange messages using iMessage, they appear in blue bubbles, whereas messages sent to iPhones from Android phones appear in green. "iMessage should not benefit from bullying," Android's official Twitter handle tweeted.

news_headline: Meta leases half of Austin's tallest skyscraper set to open in 2023
news_article: Facebook's parent company Meta has leased half of what will be Austin's tallest skyscraper, Bloomberg confirmed. The company is leasing 5,89,000 square feet across 33 floors, which accounts for the entire commercial half of the 66-storey tower, a company spokesperson said. The tower, known as Sixth and Guadalupe, is currently under construction and is scheduled to open in 2023.

news_headline: Techies getting lazy with high salaries, not upping their game: BharatPe MD
news_article: BharatPe's Co-founder and MD Ashneer Grover said, "The amount of salary the tech guys are getting paid is making them lazy. They're not thinking of evolving themselves into product managers or becoming more relevant, or upping their game." He was speaking at the Wharton India Economic Forum last week. Grover added that new-age companies are overestimating their tech-hiring requirements.

news_headline: Swiss Army bans WhatsApp, Signal, Telegram citing privacy concerns
news_article: The Swiss army has banned the use of foreign instant messaging services like WhatsApp, Signal and Telegram for official communications by army personnel. The decision was announced last month, citing privacy concerns based on the ability of US authorities to access data. A spokesperson for the army said that troops have been recommended to use Swiss instant messaging service Threema.

news_headline: CCI to seek report on Google's payment policy from app makers: Report
news_article: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) will seek a comprehensive report from app developers mentioning the impact of Google's upcoming payment policy on their balance sheet, ET reported. It will reportedly ask developers to suggest an alternative payment method. The CCI is currently probing Google's alleged unfair business practices in connection with Google Pay and Play Store payment system.

news_headline: Facebook sued by sister of US officer killed in racial justice protests
news_article: Facebook parent Meta has been sued by the sister of a security officer who was murdered during racial justice protests in the US in 2020. Angela Underwood Jacobs has claimed that Facebook bears responsibility for her brother's death. "Facebook knowingly promoted inflammatory and violent content and connected extremists who plotted and carried out the killing of my brother," she added.

news_headline: Pakistan's FIA sends notice to Binance in alleged $100 million scam
news_article: Pakistan's Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) has issued a notice to one of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchanges Binance in connection with an alleged scam worth $100 million. The FIA said many citizens reached out in December alleging several apps had stopped working and defrauded them of billions of rupees. "We are working with FIA to resolve these issues," Binance said.

news_headline: Intel deletes reference to Xinjiang in letter to suppliers after backlash
news_article: Intel has deleted references to Xinjiang from an annual letter to suppliers after it faced a backlash in China for asking suppliers to avoid the region. The letter now reads that the company prohibits "any human trafficked or involuntary labour such as forced, debt bonded, prison, indentured, or slave labour throughout your extended supply chains", media reports said.

news_headline: Workers to return to Foxconn's TN plant gradually, says Apple
news_article: Apple on Monday said that workers will return to work gradually at its Foxconn's plant at Sriperumbudur near Tamil Nadu's Chennai. Earlier, the state's CM MK Stalin had said that the Foxconn plant will resume operations on January 12, initially with 500 workers. The plant was shut last month after a food poisoning incident affected over 200 workers.

news_headline: Panasonic says hackers accessed personal data of job candidates
news_article: Panasonic has confirmed that hackers accessed personal information belonging to job candidates and interns during a cyberattack on it in November. The firm is notifying the affected people. Panasonic also confirmed that the data breach, which began on June 22 and ended on November 3, saw the hackers obtain files containing unspecified "business-related information" provided by business partners.

news_headline: ED attaches assets worth ₹36 crore in 'Morris Coin' crypto case
news_article: The Enforcement Directorate has attached assets of a Kerala-based businessman and his associates worth ₹36.72 crore under PMLA, 2002, in a cheating case. The accused had allegedly cheated 900 investors of ₹1,200 crore under the guise of offering 'Morris coin' cryptocurrency. The attached assets include balances in multiple bank accounts, immovable property and INR equivalent of cryptocurrencies.

news_headline: Software exports of STPI units likely to cross ₹5 lakh cr in FY22: Govt
news_article: Software exports from units registered under the Software Technology Parks of India (STPI) scheme are expected to cross ₹5 lakh crore in FY 2022 despite the spread of Omicron, STPI Director General Arvind Kumar said. He added that due to a "matured remote working model", the performance of units registered under the STPI scheme is expected to not be affected.

news_headline: S**** Deals app creator sent to police custody for 4 days: Police
news_article: The alleged creator of S**** Deals app Aumkareshwar Thakur has been sent to police custody for four days, ANI reported quoting Delhi Police. Thakur, said to be the mastermind in the case, was arrested from Indore by Delhi Police's IFSO Special Cell unit. The 25-year-old completed his undergraduate studies in computer application and runs an IT software company.

news_headline: Concept vehicles with 90-degree rotating wheels unveiled by Hyundai Mobis
news_article: Hyundai Mobis showcased two mobility concept vehicles with 90-degree rotating wheels at the CES 2022 tech show in Las Vegas. The vehicles feature Hyundai's e-corner module system that integrates steering, braking, suspension and driving systems into one wheel. The system also enables rotating the vehicle in place, changing the direction of the vehicle on narrow roads, and easy parking.

news_headline: UPI is operational now: NPCI after users report issues with transactions
news_article: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) on Sunday tweeted that Unified Payments Interface (UPI) was operational after facing an "intermittent technical glitch". Earlier, several users took to Twitter to report they were unable to make transactions using digital wallets and online payment platforms. "Regret the inconvenience to UPI users...we are monitoring system closely," the NPCI said.

news_headline: RBI sets up internal fintech department to drive innovation: Reports
news_article: The Reserve Bank of India has set up an internal financial technology department to drive innovation in the sector, ET Now reported. The department was set up "with a view to give further focus to...innovation in fintech sector in keeping pace with the dynamically changing landscape", an internal RBI circular dated January 4 reportedly stated.

news_headline: Panasonic offers 4-day work week option to staff, allows side jobs
news_article: Japanese multinational conglomerate Panasonic Corporation will offer employees an option to work four days a week, CEO Yuki Kusumi said in an investor briefing. Panasonic will also allow employees to take up side jobs or spend time volunteering on their extra days off. Further, employees will be able to work from home when their partners are transferred to other locations.

news_headline: Fully 3D printed flexible OLED display created by US researchers
news_article: Researchers at the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities, have developed a fully 3D printed flexible organic light-emitting diode (OLED) display. The researchers used a customised printer and combined two methods of 3D printing to produce six layers of display. The prototype is about 1.5 inch wide and has 64 pixels. The researchers claim that every pixel works and displays light.

news_headline: Bitcoin falls below $40,000 for the first time in over five months
news_article: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin's price fell below $40,000 for the first time in over five months on Monday. Bitcoin fell more than 5% to as low as $39,558, marking the largest decline for the cryptocurrency for a start of the year since at least 2012. Ether, the second largest cryptocurrency, also fell as much as 7.2% to $2,926 on Monday.

news_headline: Choose better words: Saina's husband Parupalli to Siddharth on alleged lewd tweet
news_article: Shuttler Parupalli Kashyap, the husband of shuttler Saina Nehwal, responded to actor Siddharth for his alleged lewd tweet about his wife Saina. "This is upsetting for us...express ur (your) opinion but choose better words man," Parupalli Kashyap tweeted to the actor. Actor Siddharth had tweeted "Subtle cock champion of the world" to Saina and later clarified, "Nothing disrespectful was intended".

news_headline: My daughter has won medals for India, what has he done? Nehwal's father on Siddharth
news_article: Reacting to actor Siddharth's alleged lewd tweet about Saina Nehwal, the badminton player's father Harvir said, "My daughter has won medals, brought laurels for India. What has he done for the country?" "I felt very bad when he used such words for my daughter," he further said. Harvir further demanded an apology from the actor.

news_headline: Making cheap comment on Saina shows ignoble mentality: Law Minister on Siddharth
news_article: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju has said that making a cheap comment on an iconic personality like Saina Nehwal depicted a person's "ignoble mentality". Rijiju added India is proud of Saina for her outstanding contributions and she is a steadfast patriot besides being an Olympic medalist. This comes after actor Siddharth's "Subtle cock champion of the world" tweet targeting Nehwal.

news_headline: Saina demeaned for her political stand by so-called popular actor: Smriti Irani
news_article: Union Minister Smriti Irani said badminton player Saina Nehwal was demeaned for her political position by a "so-called popular actor".  She added, "Ms Nehwal had a point of view. But she was demeaned and objectified. Should such men be brought to justice?" Actor Siddharth had tweeted "Subtle cock champion of the world" retweeting Nehwal's tweet on PM Modi's security breach.

news_headline: Who is 17-yr-old Fateh, Indian-origin cricketer with Alopecia in England U-19 WC squad?
news_article: Fateh Singh, a bowling all-rounder who's a part of England squad for Under-19 World Cup, was born on April 20, 2004 in Nottingham. Fateh's grandfather had shifted to UK from Patiala in 1965. Seven years ago, the 17-year-old developed Alopecia, an autoimmune disorder that led to complete hair loss. He was named Nottinghamshire Academy Player of the year in 2021.

news_headline: Sushil fired at dogs, assaulted fellow wrestlers hours before Sagar's murder: Chargesheet
news_article: Hours before the abduction and murder of wrestler Sagar Dhankhar, Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar, the main accused, fired at dogs at the Chhatrasal stadium, Delhi Police said in a chargesheet. He also assaulted fellow athletes with his pistol and forced them to leave, they added. Sushil wanted to kill Sagar as he was collecting information on him, a co-accused claimed.

news_headline: India announce their playing XI for 3rd Test against South Africa
news_article: India have won the toss and elected to bat first in third Test against South Africa in Cape Town. India captain Virat Kohli is back in the playing XI, replacing Hanuma Vihari. Injured Mohammed Siraj has been replaced by Umesh Yadav. Virat said, "Umesh has been very potent with ball recently, very handy in field and with bat as well."

news_headline: Djokovic shares pic from training in Australia after court overturns visa cancellation
news_article: Novak Djokovic took to Twitter to share a picture from his training in Australia ahead of Australian Open 2022. Djokovic's post came after he won a court case against his deportation and a judge overturned his visa cancellation. "Despite all that has happened, I want to stay and try to compete in Australian Open...I remain focussed on that," he wrote.

news_headline: IPL history's most expensive buy Chris Morris retires from all forms of cricket
news_article: South African all-rounder Chris Morris has announced his retirement from all forms of cricket at the age of 34. Morris, who became the most expensive buy in IPL history after being bought by Rajasthan Royals for ₹16.25 crore in 2021 auction, took 94 wickets and scored 773 runs in 69 matches for South Africa across formats between 2012 and 2019.

news_headline: Transitions happen naturally, can't be forced: Kohli on Pujara-Rahane form
news_article: Talking about Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane's current batting form ahead of third India-South Africa Test, India Test captain Virat Kohli said that the transition has to happen naturally and cannot be forced. "I can't pinpoint when we'll have those [transition] conversations," he added. Pujara and Rahane haven't hit a century since January 2019 and December 2020 respectively.

news_headline: Kohli is world class player, brings different dynamic to game: Elgar
news_article: South Africa skipper Dean Elgar said India Test captain Virat Kohli is a "world class player" and very experienced within his squad. "Kohli brings a different dynamic to the game...his name speaks for itself," he added. India and South Africa will play the third and final Test in Cape Town, beginning on Tuesday. Currently, series is levelled at 1-1.

news_headline: It's the 1st time I've seen Kohli low on confidence: Manjrekar
news_article: Former India player Sanjay Manjrekar said that this is the first time he has seen India Test captain Virat Kohli low on confidence. "We have seen that because he hasn't scored runs, his self-confidence has dipped a bit," Manjrekar stated. He added that it is possible that Kohli could bounce back in form in the third Test against South Africa.

news_headline: Managing Anderson's retirement is key for Test team's future: Vaughan
news_article: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said managing England pacer James Anderson's retirement is going to be key for the team in future. "His future is the big elephant in the room. England will find it hard without Jimmy [Anderson], but in time, they will rebuild," he added. Having played 169 Tests, the 39-year-old is second-most capped cricketer in Test cricket.

news_headline: I'm nowhere near done: Rabada ahead of his 50th Test in Cape Town
news_article: South Africa pacer Kagiso Rabada, who'll be playing his 50th Test on Tuesday in Cape Town against India, said he's nowhere near done. "For me it's about longevity...this is definitely a personal milestone," he added. The 26-year-old has taken 226 Test wickets so far. Notably, Rabada is fastest South African bowler to reach 200 Test wickets in terms of age.

news_headline: Ashwin can be India's spinning all-rounder in any condition: Kohli
news_article: Ahead of third and final Test against South Africa, Team India Test skipper Virat Kohli said off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin can play the role of spinning all-rounder for the side in any condition.  He added that Ashwin made an outstanding contribution to the team with his batting and bowling in the second Test. He hit 62 runs and took one wicket.

news_headline: Buttler is very close to inheriting white-ball captaincy: Vaughan
news_article: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said he thinks that England wicketkeeper-batter Jos Buttler is very close to inheriting the limited-overs captaincy. "If Eoin Morgan finds form this summer, then keep him, but if not then make Buttler captain for the T20 World Cup in November," he stated. Buttler scored 269 and Morgan 68 runs in T20 World Cup 2021.

news_headline: It's not serious: Rangnick on Ronaldo missing FA Cup win due to injury
news_article: Explaining Cristiano Ronaldo's absence from their 1-0 FA Cup third-round win over Aston Villa, Manchester United interim coach Ralf Rangnick said Cristiano is having some problems with his hip muscles. "Cristiano told me he's had some problems for the last couple of days...it's [not] serious...[but] we thought it would be better to not take any risks," Rangnick stated.

news_headline: 24-time world champion cueist Pankaj tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Twenty-four time world champion cueist Pankaj Advani has tested positive for COVID-19, the 36-year-old confirmed on Monday. "Have been shivering the last two days and feeling feverish," he tweeted. "Despite taking all precautions, I ended up getting infected. I've never experienced this kind of shivering and thought of testing myself...hopefully I'll recover in a week," Pankaj added.

news_headline: Rahul tried his best, handled captaincy in 2nd Test in balanced way: Kohli
news_article: Team India Test captain Virat Kohli has said that KL Rahul handled captaincy in a balanced way in the second Test against South Africa. "What I saw from his plans and field placements is that he tried his best to get wickets...I don't think anything much could have [been] done," Kohli stated. SA won the second Test by seven wickets.

news_headline: It was damaging on all fronts: ATP on Djokovic's visa controversy
news_article: The ATP, governing body of men's tennis, has welcomed the Australian court's ruling against world number one Novak Djokovic's deportation over his COVID-19 vaccine medical exemption. The body, however, also added that the controversy has been "damaging on all fronts". It further said that the situation highlighted the need for a clearer understanding and communication of the rules.

news_headline: Team India will be feeling more pressure: Nehra on 3rd SA-India Test
news_article: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra has said India will feel more pressure as compared to South Africa in the final Test, beginning on Tuesday. "India were leading 1-0 [but] the way South Africa chased 240 in testing conditions [in the second Test], they've definitely put India under [more] pressure," he explained. India have never won a Test series in South Africa.

news_headline: SA's 2015 ODI series win in India stands out for me: Rabada
news_article: South Africa pacer Kagiso Rabada revealed that victory against India in 2015 ODI series stands out for him. "We became...first South African touring team to beat India in an ODI series away from home," he added. South Africa had won series 3-2 after being tied at 2-2. Third India-South Africa Test, beginning Tuesday, will be the 26-year-old's 50th Test.

news_headline: Jhye Richardson is more skillful bowler than Scott Boland: Ponting
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has opined that Australia pacer Jhye Richardson is "better and more skillful" than Scott Boland. "Richardson is probably a more skillful bowler when you think about all the conditions," Ponting stated. He further added that pitches at the MCG and SCG favoured Boland. Boland has taken 14 wickets in two Tests of the ongoing Ashes series.

news_headline: It's great to finish off career with win and a wicket: Taylor
news_article: Speaking after his career's last Test match, New Zealand batter Ross Taylor said it was great to finish off with a "win and a wicket". Taylor picked his Test career's third wicket to help NZ defeat Bangladesh by an innings and 117 runs. "I've thoroughly enjoyed representing my country...it's a great way to finish," Taylor stated.

news_headline: It's the biggest game for us in last 10-15 years: Elgar on 3rd SA-India Test
news_article: South Africa captain Dean Elgar has said the third and final Test against India is the biggest game for them in the last 10-15 years. He added, "Beating the world number one side even though it's in your back garden, it's still going to speak massive amounts for our players." The third Test will begin on Tuesday in Cape Town.

news_headline: Protestors throw seaweed, stones at French MP over COVID-19 vaccine pass
news_article: Protestors opposing a bill on COVID-19 vaccine pass, threw seaweed, dirt and stones at French MP Stéphane Claireaux, outside his home. A video of the incident has also surfaced on social media. The French government is seeking to pass a law that would require residents to show proof of their vaccination to access public venues and transport.

news_headline: US sees record COVID-19 hospitalisations as record 11 lakh test positive
news_article: COVID-19 hospitalisations in the US reached a record high on Monday at 1,32,646 amid Omicron, according to Reuters. The United States reported at least 11.3 lakh new coronavirus infections on Monday, the highest daily total of any country in the world, Reuters said. Hospitalisations in the US have increased steadily since late December, doubling in the last three weeks.

news_headline: Man in US gets genetically-modified pig heart in world-first transplant
news_article: David Bennett, a 57-year-old US man, has become the first person in the world to get a heart transplant from a genetically-modified pig. Bennett is doing well three days after the experimental seven-hour procedure in Baltimore, doctors said. Doctors had deemed him ineligible for a human transplant due to very poor health.

news_headline: Video shows mother throwing baby into dumpster in US; says 'Didn't know what to do'
news_article: An 18-year-old mother was caught on surveillance footage throwing her newborn baby alive into a dumpster in US' New Mexico. Alexis Avila told investigators she didn't know she was pregnant until January 6, when she sought medical attention because she was suffering from abdominal pain. She said she "panicked and did not know what to do or who to call".

news_headline: Robert Durst, US multi-millionaire real estate heir convicted of murder, dies at 78
news_article: Multi-millionaire real estate heir Robert Durst, who was sentenced to life in prison in October for murdering his best friend, has died at 78 in a California prison hospital, according to his attorney. He was also charged with murder of his first wife Kathleen Durst, who disappeared in 1982. Robert Durst was the subject of a 2015 HBO documentary series.

news_headline: UC Berkeley professor Pierre-Olivier succeeds Gita Gopinath as IMF Chief Economist
news_article: The IMF has appointed Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas as its next Chief Economist, succeeding India-born Gita Gopinath. Gourinchas is the University of California at Berkeley's Faculty Director of the Clausen Center for International Business and Policy. He will start his new position on January 24 part-time and transition to full-time on April 1. Gopinath will become IMF's First Deputy MD.

news_headline: Police officers ignore active robbery to catch Snorlax in Pokemon Go in US
news_article: Two police officers in US' Los Angeles were fired for ignoring a robbery in progress and instead trying to catch a Snorlax in Pokemon Go, according to court documents published on Friday. The incident happened in April, 2017, at a mall. The police officers were in the area but didn't respond to the call and instead drove away.

news_headline: We have enough vaccines for all Canadians to get 4th dose: Trudeau
news_article: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said the government has secured enough COVID-19 vaccine doses for all eligible Canadians to receive a booster as well as a fourth dose. This comes as the country grapples with rising infection and hospitalisation rates due to the Omicron variant. More than 87% of Canadians aged 12 and older have received two COVID-19 vaccine doses.

news_headline: China halts some US flights after COVID-19 cases among arrivals
news_article: China has ordered the cancellation of over two dozen scheduled flights from US in recent weeks after numerous passengers arriving in the country tested COVID-19 positive. A US-China air agreement allows the countries to operate over 100 weekly flights between the nations, but currently, only a fraction of those are operating. The US has reported over 6.1 crore COVID-19 cases.

news_headline: Mexican Prez tests COVID-19 +ve for 2nd time, says symptoms are 'mild'
news_article: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said he has tested positive for coronavirus for the second time, but his symptoms are "mild". The 68-year-old, who rarely wears a face mask, got tested after he'd sounded hoarse at a Monday morning news briefing. "I'll remain isolated and only work from the office and hold online meetings until further notice," he added.

news_headline: Do not travel to Canada: US to citizens over COVID-19 surge
news_article: The US on Monday advised its citizens to "avoid travel" to Canada because of a rising number of COVID-19 cases in the neighbouring country. Canadian health officials on Friday had said that new daily cases had soared by 65% in the previous week, threatening healthcare systems. Canada is facing a COVID-19 surge due to the highly transmissible Omicron variant.

news_headline: Sweden to tighten COVID-19 curbs amid rising infections: PM
news_article: Sweden will introduce new curbs to limit COVID-19 spread amid a "historically high level" of infections, PM Magdalena Andersson said on Monday. Sweden, which reported 60,000 COVID-19 cases last week, will from Wednesday onwards not allow restaurants to seat groups larger than eight people. Public events with over 50 people will be permitted if attendees can provide proof of vaccination.

news_headline: Looking forward to stabilisation of situation: India on Kazakhstan
news_article: Speaking about the recent developments in Kazakhstan, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Monday said that it's looking "forward to an early stabilisation of the situation". "We express our deepest condolences to families of innocent victims who have lost lives in the violence," it added. Kazakhstan authorities on Sunday said that 164 people were killed in last week's protests.

news_headline: Iraq's new Parliament elects Speaker months after national election
news_article: The new Parliament in Iraq elected Sunni lawmaker, Mohammed al-Halbousi as the Speaker on Sunday, three months after the national election. The incumbent speaker, Halbousi won after securing 200 votes in the 329-seat house defeating acting Speaker Mahmoud al-Mashahadani. This comes after the Parliament observed heated debates from parties over leadership of the house.

news_headline: Iran Foreign Minister to discuss cooperation agreement with China
news_article: The Iranian Foreign Ministry said that the Foreign Minister, Hossein Amirabdollahian, will visit China by the end of this week to discuss the 25-year cooperation agreement along with various issues. The two countries signed the comprehensive strategic partnership agreement to strengthen their economic and political alliance in March 2021. This comes after both were subjected to US sanctions.

news_headline: North Korea fires 2nd suspected missile in less than a week
news_article: South Korea and Japan on Tuesday said North Korea has fired a "suspected ballistic missile", less than a week after it launched what it claimed was a hypersonic missile. South Korea's National Security Council held an emergency meeting and expressed "strong regret" over the test. The launch comes after six countries, including US, urged North Korea to end "destabilising actions".

news_headline: 72-year-old US man arrested for threatening to kidnap, kill Trump
news_article: A 72-year-old US man has been arrested and charged with allegedly threatening to kidnap and kill ex-President Donald Trump, a criminal indictment showed. Thomas Welnicki, who made a series of threats between July 2020 and December 2021, had at least once referred to Trump as "Hitler" and said he would do "everything" he can to make sure Trump was killed.

news_headline: Myanmar military govt accuses US diplomats of COVID rules violation
news_article: The military government in Myanmar has accused US diplomats of breaking coronavirus-related rules of the country. The government said that two US diplomats were allowed to receive treatment for COVID-19 at properties of the American embassy without any permission from local authorities. This was done despite the embassy being informed to admit the patients to designated hospitals, it added.

news_headline: China offers Kazakhstan support to deter 'external forces' amid riots
news_article: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Monday said that China is willing to support Kazakhstan maintain stability amid anti-government protests. Wang, who spoke to Kazakh Deputy PM, said Beijing can increase "law enforcement and security cooperation" with Kazakhstan and help the country oppose interference by "external forces". Riots triggered by a fuel price hike broke out last week in Kazakhstan.

news_headline: Sudan pro-democracy group rejects UN offer for talks with military
news_article: Sudan's leading pro-democracy group, the Sudanese Professionals' Association (SPA) rejected UN's offer to mediate talks with the military. SPA said that the "only way" out of the ongoing crisis is through the removal of the generals from power. The group reiterated its demand for a fully civilian government. Sudan plunged into crisis after a military coup in October last year.

news_headline: Kazakhstan govt blames Islamic radicals for unrest, detains 8,000
news_article: Kazakhstan Foreign Ministry on Monday said that the country was subjected to armed aggression by radical Islamist groups. The ministry added that the government detained nearly 8,000 people to control the situation. This comes after government buildings and security forces were attacked last week after peaceful protests over fuel price hike turned into violent anti-government demonstrations.

news_headline: Philippines sees record high daily COVID-19 cases for 3rd straight day
news_article: The Philippines reported 33,169 new COVID-19 cases on Monday, logging a record high caseload for the third straight day. The authorities added that 145 deaths were confirmed taking the death toll to over 50,000. However, the existing restrictions allowing restaurants, gyms to operate at 30% capacity will remain. The country reported 26,458 and 28,707 cases on Saturday and Sunday respectively.

news_headline: Nearly 10,000 detained in Kazakhstan over violent protests
news_article: Nearly 10,000 people in Kazakhstan were detained by security forces during the violent anti-government protests last week, the Interior Ministry said. "A substantial number of foreign nationals" were among the detainees, officials said. Kazakhstan's President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev had said the protests, in which at least 164 people were killed, were instigated by "terrorists" with foreign backing.

news_headline: Israel not bound by any nuclear deal with Iran: PM Naftali Bennett
news_article: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett said on Monday that Israel isn't bound by any nuclear deal with Iran and is free to act without “constraints" against Iran if necessary. PM Bennett’s comments come amid indirect talks between US and Iran to restart the stalled 2015 Iran nuclear deal. Israel had condemned this deal and views a nuclear-armed Iran as existential threat.

news_headline: European Parliament President David Sassoli dies aged 65
news_article: European Parliament President David Sassoli has died at the age of 65, his spokesman said. He was admitted to hospital in Italy last month due to a "serious complication" with his immune system. Sassoli left a three-decade career in journalism and became a member of the European Parliament in 2009. He was elected as the European Parliament President in 2019.

news_headline: Shivakumar seen 'coughing' refuses COVID-19 test, says 'you can't force me'
news_article: Amid a surge in COVID-19 cases, Congress leader DK Shivakumar has refused to undergo a COVID-19 test. "I am fit and fine. You can't compel me [to give my sample]...Tell your Home Minister I am perfect," Shivakumar said. This comes after Karnataka BJP on Sunday shared a video on Twitter purportedly showing Shivakumar coughing during a protest march in Karnataka.

news_headline: Saina demeaned for her political stand by so-called popular actor: Smriti Irani
news_article: Union Minister Smriti Irani said badminton player Saina Nehwal was demeaned for her political position by a "so-called popular actor".  She added, "Ms Nehwal had a point of view. But she was demeaned and objectified. Should such men be brought to justice?" Actor Siddharth had tweeted "Subtle cock champion of the world" retweeting Nehwal's tweet on PM Modi's security breach.

news_headline: Making cheap comment on Saina shows ignoble mentality: Law Minister on Siddharth
news_article: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju has said that making a cheap comment on an iconic personality like Saina Nehwal depicted a person's "ignoble mentality". Rijiju added India is proud of Saina for her outstanding contributions and she is a steadfast patriot besides being an Olympic medalist. This comes after actor Siddharth's "Subtle cock champion of the world" tweet targeting Nehwal.

news_headline: PM Modi's picture, name excluded from vaccination certificates in 5 poll-bound states
news_article: The Health Ministry has removed PM Narendra Modi’s picture and name from the COVID-19 vaccination certificates being issued in the five poll-bound states. This is in accordance with the Model Code of Conduct coming into effect in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Goa and Manipur from Saturday. The elections will be held between February 10 and March 7 in seven phases.

news_headline: Amarinder Singh's party gets hockey stick & ball as election symbol
news_article:
Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh's newly-launched party, Punjab Lok Congress, has been allotted a hockey stick and ball as an election symbol by the Election Commission. 
"Now all that is left is to score the goal," the party tweeted. Punjab will go to the polls on  February 14 and the results will be announced on March 10.

news_headline: Michael Lobo resigns as Goa minister, quits BJP ahead of polls
news_article: Goa minister and BJP MLA Michael Lobo on Monday announced that he's resigned from both his posts and has also quit from the party, ahead of the state Assembly polls scheduled for next month. "Voters told me that...BJP is no more a party of the common people," he said. He added that he is "in talks with other political parties".

news_headline: Actor Sonu Sood's sister Malvika joins Congress ahead of Punjab elections
news_article: Ahead of the Punjab Assembly elections, actor Sonu Sood’s sister Malvika Sood joined the Congress party in Moga on Monday. Several pictures of Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu meeting the actor and his sister surfaced on social media. In November, Sonu Sood had announced that his sister Malvika will join politics and would decide the political party soon.

news_headline: Goa MLA Zantye quits BJP, says 'was sidelined after Parrikar's death'
news_article: Goa MLA Pravin Zantye on Monday quit the ruling BJP ahead of the state Assembly elections on February 14. The legislator from the Mayem seat said he was sidelined in the party after the death of former CM Manohar Parrikar. Earlier in the day, Goa Minister and BJP MLA Michael Lobo announced his resignation from his post and the party.

news_headline: Can't wait to see her flourish: Sonu Sood wishes sister as she joins Congress
news_article: Actor Sonu Sood's sister Malvika Sood on Monday joined the Congress party in Punjab. Taking to Twitter, he tweeted, "As my sister, Malvika Sood embarks on her political journey, I...can't wait to see her flourish in this new chapter of her life." Sonu added that his work as an actor and humanitarian will continue "without any political affiliations or distractions".

news_headline: 30 booked for COVID-19 violations during Cong's Mekedatu protest
news_article: An FIR has been filed against 30 people for violating coronavirus protocols during Congress' protest seeking the implementation of the Mekedatu drinking water project, Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said on Monday. He added that the Ramanagara district administration has taken the action as per law. "We will not spare anybody who violates the law," he further added.

news_headline: This election is between BJP's kaam, Congress' karnama: U'khand CM
news_article: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Monday, "This election is between our kaam (work) and [Congress'] karnama (misdeeds)." He added that BJP will publicise the development works done by his government in the upcoming Uttarakhand Assembly election. Dhami said that his party will follow all COVID-19 guidelines and that he is confident of winning the upcoming election.

news_headline: BJP national president JP Nadda tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) national president JP Nadda on Monday confirmed that he had tested positive for COVID-19. Taking to Twitter, he said, "I am feeling fine and have isolated myself on the advice of doctors." Several political leaders, including Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, have tested positive for COVID-19 today.

news_headline: Will work to pool anti-BJP votes in poll-bound states: CPI(M)
news_article: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury on Sunday said that the party would work towards maximising the pooling of anti-BJP votes in the five poll-bound states and will support the Samajwadi Party (SP) in UP. Whether there will be any seat adjustment and alliance in UP will be left to the SP, which will have to take the initiative, he added.

news_headline: Called Punjab CM due to concern over PM's security lapse: Priyanka
news_article: Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has said that she called Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi after PM Narendra Modi's security breach on January 5 out of concern. "I have no constitutional post...I was worried about the PM...I [spoke] to Channi ji as a colleague only,” Priyanka said. PM Narendra Modi is 'desh ke pradhamantri', (country's prime minister) she added.

news_headline: Sidhu launches digital campaign ahead of Punjab Assembly polls
news_article: Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu on Sunday launched the party's digital campaign ahead of the Assembly elections. Emphasising the need for "Digital Punjab", Sidhu said, "Our social media war room...has [over] 10,000 WhatsApp groups...we are reaching to people...via...digital means.” Speaking about the 'Punjab Model', Sidhu said it is a tailor-made solution for issues prevalent in state.

news_headline: Cong suffering from guilty conscience: K'taka CM on Mekedatu rally
news_article: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday criticised Congress for defying COVID-19 rules by staging a 'padayatra' demanding implementation of the Mekedatu project, saying that the party is suffering from a "guilty conscience". He said that Congress didn't take up the issue in the last three years and are now doing a "politically motivated" padayatra. He also warned of action.

news_headline: Bihar BJP MLA Rashmi Verma quits post citing personal reasons
news_article: BJP MLA from Bihar's Narkatiaganj, Rashmi Verma, has resigned citing "personal reasons", days after her brother was arrested for his alleged involvement in UPTET paper leak case. Verma had won the Narkatiaganj seat on JDU ticket in 2014 and on BJP ticket in 2020. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra had alleged Verma's involvement in the paper leak case.

news_headline: Mayawati urges EC to curb rising use of religion during elections
news_article: BSP chief Mayawati on Sunday expressed concern over the "increasing" use of religion during elections and urged Election Commission (EC) to "take serious steps to curb the narrow politics of selfishness". This comes after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that upcoming state Assembly elections will be "80% versus 20%", alluding to the about 20% Muslim population in the state.

news_headline: Section 144 imposed in Chamoli district ahead of Uttarakhand polls
news_article: Ahead of Uttarakhand Assembly elections, Section 144 has been imposed from January 8 in Chamoli district to conduct the polls in a peaceful manner, said Chamoli DM Himanshu Khurana. Dehradun DM has also imposed Section 144 in the district, however, the order is not applicable on door-to-door visits of poll candidates. Uttarakhand elections are scheduled for February 14.

news_headline: BJP fully prepared for digital rallies in U'khand: Union Minister
news_article: Union Minister Ajay Bhatt has said that BJP is fully prepared for digital rallies in Uttarakhand after Election Commission barred physical rallies in poll-bound states till January 15 amid rising COVID-19 infections. "We'll try to connect with the areas [having] low connectivity in small groups," he said. Uttarakhand will witness single-phase polling for Assembly elections on February 14.

news_headline: No alliance with AAP for Punjab polls: Sanyukt Samaj Morcha
news_article: Sanyukt Samaj Morcha (SSM) leader Balbir Singh Rajewal has ruled out an alliance with Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for the upcoming Punjab Assembly elections. While speaking to media, Rajewal said that all SSM candidates for the elections will be declared in a week. He also termed suggestions of SSM seeking 60 seats while AAP only offered ten seats as "baseless".

news_headline: BJP shares video of Shivakumar 'coughing' during protest in K'taka
news_article: The Twitter handle of Karnataka BJP on Sunday shared a purported video of Congress leader DK Shivakumar coughing during Mekedatu dam protest with the hashtag "#SuperSpreaderCONgress". "It appears that [Shivakumar] is having COVID-19 symptoms but is still interacting with Congress workers without a mask," the party alleged. It further questioned, "Is he hell bent on increasing [COVID-19] cases?"

news_headline: Digvijaya compares RSS to 'termites', says it works 'discreetly'
news_article: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Monday used the "termite" analogy to criticise RSS, saying that like termites silently damage houses, similarly RSS works "discreetly and damages the entire system". He clarified that he wasn't calling RSS a termite, but the "character of the ideology". He added that a false narrative is being created that Hinduism is in danger.

news_headline: Can't give Hindus' money: VHP on Patnaik giving funds to Christian group
news_article: After Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik sanctioned ₹79 lakh as assistance to the Missionaries of Charity from Chief Minister's Relief Fund, the Vishva Hindu Parishad has opposed the decision. VHP General Secretary Milind Parande said, "Missionaries of Charity is involved in conversion." He added that no Chief Minister has right to give money of Hindus to organisation that converts them.

news_headline: Tharoor tweets word 'anocracy', says 'we'd better learn it in India'
news_article: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday tweeted that people in India should "better" start learning the word "anocracy", in an apparent reference to government ahead of polls. He said that it means a "form of government that mixes democratic with autocratic features". "[Such a government] permits elections, allows participation through opposition...but acts with minimal accountability," he added.

news_headline: Veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar in ICU after testing COVID-19 positive
news_article: Veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai on Tuesday after she tested positive for COVID-19. The 92-year-old is currently undergoing treatment at the intensive care unit (ICU) of Mumbai's Breach Candy hospital. "She has mild symptoms. She has been kept in ICU only for precautionary reasons considering her age," her niece confirmed to news agency ANI.

news_headline: My daughter has won medals for India, what has he done? Nehwal's father on Siddharth
news_article: Reacting to actor Siddharth's alleged lewd tweet about Saina Nehwal, the badminton player's father Harvir said, "My daughter has won medals, brought laurels for India. What has he done for the country?" "I felt very bad when he used such words for my daughter," he further said. Harvir further demanded an apology from the actor.

news_headline: Making cheap comment on Saina shows ignoble mentality: Law Minister on Siddharth
news_article: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju has said that making a cheap comment on an iconic personality like Saina Nehwal depicted a person's "ignoble mentality". Rijiju added India is proud of Saina for her outstanding contributions and she is a steadfast patriot besides being an Olympic medalist. This comes after actor Siddharth's "Subtle cock champion of the world" tweet targeting Nehwal.

news_headline: Vir Das tests COVID-19 +ve, says 'Was in contact with just 2 other people in last month'
news_article: Comedian Vir Das took to Instagram to share that he has tested positive for coronavirus. "Had only been in contact with two other people in the last month and thankfully they are both negative," Vir wrote. He further said that he has mild symptoms and he has isolated himself at home. "Wear a mask and get boosted," he further wrote.

news_headline: Saina demeaned for her political stand by so-called popular actor: Smriti Irani
news_article: Union Minister Smriti Irani said badminton player Saina Nehwal was demeaned for her political position by a "so-called popular actor".  She added, "Ms Nehwal had a point of view. But she was demeaned and objectified. Should such men be brought to justice?" Actor Siddharth had tweeted "Subtle cock champion of the world" retweeting Nehwal's tweet on PM Modi's security breach.

news_headline: Ayushmann Khurrana buys apartment in Mumbai for ₹19 crore: Reports
news_article: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has bought an apartment in Mumbai's Andheri West for around ₹19 crore, Moneycontrol reported. The total size of the apartment is 4,027 sq ft and it comes with parking for four cars, reports added. Ayushmann's brother Aparshakti Khurana also bought a property in the same housing complex for ₹7 crore, reports further stated.

news_headline: Ranveer Singh-starrer '83' crosses ₹100 crore mark in 17 days
news_article: Ranveer Singh-starrer '83' has crossed ₹100 crore mark at the domestic box office, the makers said on Monday. The film, which released on December 24, has earned ₹100.56 crore in India so far. Recently, director Kabir Khan called the film "a victim of the pandemic" and said, "This is a film that has been hit hard by COVID on...daily basis."

news_headline: More power to you: Zoya Akhtar supports actress Bhavana Menon
news_article: Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar took to Instagram stories to support Malayalam actress Bhavana Menon amid her sexual assault case involving actor Dileep, writing, "More power to you." Bhavana released her first statement on Monday, writing, "There have been many attempts to humiliate, silence and isolate me." The actress was allegedly abducted and molested in Kerala on February 17, 2017.

news_headline: Salman is calling it 'Pawan Putra Bhaijaan': Kabir on Bajrangi Bhaijaan sequel
news_article: In an interview when director Kabir Khan was asked about Bajrangi Bhaijaan's sequel, he said that the film's original scriptwriter KV Vijayendra Prasad has started working on the sequel's script. Kabir added that Salman is calling the sequel 'Pawan Putra Bhaijaan' and he announced the film because he's excited about it. "Salman doesn't follow protocols of formal announcements," he added.

news_headline: Fascinated by Day-Lewis who can transform like a chameleon: Ranveer
news_article: Actor Ranveer Singh has said he attempts to create distinctive characters, having been fascinated as an aspiring actor by Daniel Day-Lewis who transforms himself like a "chameleon". "Growing up as an aspiring actor, I felt most fascinated with those actors who are able to show a wide range in their repertoire...who can be shape-shifters, chameleons like Daniel Day-Lewis," said Ranveer.

news_headline: Can't be lazy now when Tiger Shroff stands in front of me: Hrithik
news_article: In an interview, actor Hrithik Roshan praised his 'War' co-star Tiger Shroff and said, "I really enjoy this circle that has been created with Tiger because now when he stands in front of me, I cannot be lazy and complacent." Hrithik added, "I am so grateful to myself that I inspired someone who is now inspiring me back."

news_headline: Tara to headline 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad's thriller film: Reports
news_article: Tara Sutaria will reportedly play the lead role in 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad Khetani's next film. It is a thriller drama and Tara will be seen in a new light in the film, reports stated. Tara, who was recently seen alongside Ahan Shetty in 'Tadap', is also a part of Ahmed Khan's 'Heropanti 2' and Mohit Suri's 'Ek Villain Returns'.

news_headline: Always a blessing: Ananya Panday on working with Deepika Padukone
news_article: Having worked with Deepika Padukone in their upcoming movie 'Gehraiyaan', actress Ananya Panday said it is always a blessing to work with actors like Deepika who deliver stronger performances. "It's always a blessing to have stronger performances opposite you to feed. If I've learned anything [from Deepika], it's that acting is a lot of reacting," added Ananya.

news_headline: 'Baahubali' actor Sathyaraj discharged from hospital
news_article: Veteran actor Sathyaraj, who was hospitalised after contracting COVID-19, has been discharged. The 'Baahubali' actor's son Sibi Sathyaraj confirmed on Tuesday that the 67-year-old actor is back home. "He's totally fine and will resume work after [a] few days of rest. Thank you all for your love and support," Sibi wrote on Twitter.

news_headline: Rajkummar wants to earn Oscar nomination for my biopic: Srikanth Bolla
news_article: Discussing an interaction with Rajkummar Rao who will be portraying the lead role in visually-impaired industrialist Srikanth Bolla's biopic, Bolla said RajKummar wants to deliver a career-best performance and earn the film an Oscar nomination. "He is...inspired after hearing my...story. [RajKummar] will be coming to Hyderabad to live with me for understanding my life...better," added Bolla.

news_headline: Can't wait to see her flourish: Sonu Sood wishes sister as she joins Congress
news_article: Actor Sonu Sood's sister Malvika Sood on Monday joined the Congress party in Punjab. Taking to Twitter, he tweeted, "As my sister, Malvika Sood embarks on her political journey, I...can't wait to see her flourish in this new chapter of her life." Sonu added that his work as an actor and humanitarian will continue "without any political affiliations or distractions".

news_headline: Hrithik Roshan is more than just his looks: Agneepath director Karan
news_article: Karan Malhotra, who directed Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Agneepath', praised the actor and said he's more than just his looks. Speaking about his favourite film of Hrithik, Karan said, "If I say 'Agneepath', I'll sound pompous. But...he was...superlative in that." "I also...loved him in 'Koi...Mil Gaya' and 'Guzaarish'...In both those films, it [was] just about his performance and craft," Karan said.

news_headline: Almost cracked it: Badshah on video showing 'how to make a Badshah song in 2 mins'
news_article: Rapper Badshah has reacted to a video on 'How to make a Badshah song in two minutes!'. Anshuman Sharma, a music producer, took to Twitter on Monday to share the video showing eight steps on "how to sound like Badshah in two minutes". Badshah shared the video and wrote, "I swear, he almost cracked it," with a laughing emoji.

news_headline: There is superstardom and then there’s SRK: Tahir Raj Bhasin
news_article: Talking about Shah Rukh Khan trivia being included in his upcoming series 'Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein', actor Tahir Raj Bhasin said Shah Rukh Khan's legacy is greater than that of a superstar. "There is superstardom and then there's Shah Rukh Khan. He...[represents] an institution of someone who has a dream and puts in everything to make it," said Tahir.

news_headline: Man dressed as Spider-Man dances on 'Saami Saami', Allu Sirish shares video
news_article: Allu Arjun's brother and actor Allu Sirish took to Twitter to share a video of a man dressed as Spider-Man recreating Rashmika Mandanna's steps on song 'Saami Saami' from film 'Pushpa: The Rise'. "Spider-Man celebrating his success dancing to 'Rara Saami' from 'Pushpa'! As a fan of AA and Spidey...Waah! This is India boss. @SpiderMan good job buddy," Sirish wrote.

news_headline: My work has helped me become positive about getting 2nd looks: Dinklage
news_article: Responding to a query about how he responds to attention generated due to his height, actor Peter Dinklage said he used to get disturbed by the second looks received, but has become more positively inclined due to his professional success. "Now there's an ownership to someone looking at me. The work I've done...has afforded them a second look," said Dinklage.

news_headline: 9-month-old son was COVID +ve, his temperature was 102: Aditi Malik
news_article: Actress Aditi Malik on Monday announced that her nine-month-old son Ekbir, along with one of her house helps, had tested positive for COVID-19, adding that his temperature was 102 degrees. "By God's grace, he is out of it," she added. Aditi further wrote on Instagram that her family was isolated in separate rooms and tested negative after they finished quarantining.

news_headline: My mother is a slight nag, she's very scary: Soha on Sharmila Tagore
news_article: Speaking about her mother, veteran actress Sharmila Tagore, actress Soha Ali Khan said she's a "slight nag". Soha added, "She's very scary actually, it's not sweet at all. Everyone who says Bangla is such a mishti (sweet) language...it's not [that] at all." "[My mom] would only lose her temper in Bangla and do hisaab kitaab (accounts) in Bangla," Soha said.

news_headline: I'm complaint box, he addresses everything: Ameesha on co-star Sunny
news_article: Actress Ameesha Patel, who will be returning to screen with sequel of her movie 'Gadar' said that her co-star and actor Sunny Deol addresses all complaints she makes. "He is extremely helpful and supportive...every time I have complaints I go to him. I feel like complaint box and feel sorry for him for addressing this side of me," she said.

news_headline: Salman to make cameo appearance in Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather': Reports
news_article: Salman Khan will make a cameo appearance in Chiranjeevi starrer 'Godfather', as per reports. He will reportedly start shooting for his extended cameo in Hyderabad by January-end or by February first week. He has allotted five to seven days for the film. The upcoming film is the official remake of Malayalam film 'Lucifer', which featured Mohanlal in the lead role.

news_headline: China unveils driverless bullet train for Winter Olympics with 350km/hr as top speed
news_article: China has unveiled custom-made driverless Fuxing bullet train that has top speed of 350 km/hr for the upcoming Beijing Winter Olympics. It is equipped with a 5G-linked broadcast studio from which journalists can broadcast and special lockers for athletes to stow their ski equipment. The Beijing Olympic Games are set to begin from February 4.

news_headline: Mercedes-Benz e-car concept has over 1,000 km range, mushroom fibre seats
news_article: Mercedes-Benz unveiled its VISION EQXX electric car concept at the CES technology show in Las Vegas, which the company claims can run for more than 1,000 kilometres on a single battery charge. The car's electric system draws additional energy from solar cells on the roof. The car's interiors are made from sustainable materials like mushroom fibres, ground-up cacti and bamboo.

news_headline: Tesla criticised for opening showroom in Xinjiang, where China is accused of genocide
news_article: Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has been criticised in the US after opening a showroom in Xinjiang, where China has been accused of genocide against Uighur Muslims. Tesla announced the showroom on its Weibo page on December 31. Alliance for American Manufacturing's President Scott Paul, said, "Any company doing business in Xinjiang is complicit in the cultural genocide taking place there."

news_headline: BMW unveils concept car that changes colour with the touch of a button
news_article: BMW has unveiled its all-electric concept car 'BMW iX Flow' that changes its colour with the touch of a button. The car's surface colour changes using a technology based on E Ink, the technology used in e-readers. The car can change colours from black to white or combine black and white in a kaleidoscope of graphics.

news_headline: Pvt sector should oppose China's genocide: US as Tesla opens showroom in Xinjiang
news_article: After billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla opened a showroom in Xinjiang, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "We believe the private sector should oppose China's human rights abuses and genocide in Xinjiang." "The international community, including the public and private sectors, cannot look the other way when it comes to what is taking place in Xinjiang," she added.

news_headline: Musk trolls GM for selling only 26 EVs in Q4 2021 in US, says 'Room to improve'
news_article: World's richest person and Tesla's CEO Elon Musk trolled rival company General Motors (GM) after it sold only 26 electric vehicles in the US in Q4 of 2021. "Room to improve," tweeted Musk. General Motors' sales numbers come amid the White House promoting it as a "leader" in the electric vehicle market.

news_headline: Toyota overtakes GM as US' top-selling automaker for first time since 1931
news_article: Japan's Toyota Motor outsold General Motors (GM) in the US in 2021, marking the first time since 1931 that GM has not led auto sales in the country. It also marked the first time that a non-domestic automaker has taken the top spot in US. While Toyota sold 2.332 million vehicles in US last year, GM sold 2.218 million vehicles.

news_headline: Tesla raises Full Self-Driving software price to $12,000 in US: Musk
news_article: Tesla will raise the price of its advanced driver assistant software, known as 'Full Self-Driving' (FSD), from $10,000 to $12,000 in the US on January 17, the company's billionaire CEO Elon Musk announced on Twitter. The software includes features like automatic lane-changing, stop light recognition, and 'Smart Summon'. Tesla had earlier raised FSD price from $8,000 to $10,000 in 2020.

news_headline: BMW, Mercedes to skip planned in-person events at CES 2022
news_article: Auto giants Mercedes and BMW have announced they will not be attending in-person CES 2022. "As the health and safety of our customers, partners, employees and guests are our highest priority," Mercedes said. Panasonic, which had planned an in-person press conference for January 4, has shifted to a virtual event and will only have a limited presence at the show.

news_headline: China to cut new energy vehicle subsidies by 30% in 2022
news_article: China's Finance Ministry has said the nation will cut its subsidies on new energy vehicles (NEV), such as electric cars by 30% next year. The 2022 NEV subsidies policy will terminate on December 31, 2022, and NEV will not be subsidised afterwards. Subsidies in case of NEVs for public transport would be cut by 20% in 2022.

news_headline: Concept vehicles with 90-degree rotating wheels unveiled by Hyundai Mobis
news_article: Hyundai Mobis showcased two mobility concept vehicles with 90-degree rotating wheels at the CES 2022 tech show in Las Vegas. The vehicles feature Hyundai's e-corner module system that integrates steering, braking, suspension and driving systems into one wheel. The system also enables rotating the vehicle in place, changing the direction of the vehicle on narrow roads, and easy parking.

news_headline: Hyundai builds air purifier using IONIQ 5 EV car parts; shares video
news_article: Hyundai has released a video in which it scrapped one of its IONIQ 5 test vehicles entirely, and repurposed the car's parts to make an air purifier. The model "went through numerous tests to ensure our safety", Hyundai said. The vehicle was used to test the likes of the Acoustic Vehicle Alerting System, pass-by noise regulation and wind tunnel noise.

news_headline: China says Tesla will recall 2 lakh vehicles over security risks
news_article: China has said Tesla will recall around two lakh vehicles produced during certain period of time due to possible security risks. Tesla will recall 19,697 imported model S vehicles, 35,836 imported model 3s, and 1,44,208 China-made model 3 vehicles in China. This comes after Tesla recalled over 4,75,000 cars in the US over issues that increase the risk of crashing.

news_headline: Tesla raises prices of Model 3, Model Y vehicles in China: Report
news_article: Tesla has reportedly raised the prices of two of its car models made in China for the second time in just over a month. Tesla has announced a 3.9% increase in the price of Model 3 and a 7.5% rise in price of Model Y, SCMP reported. The basic edition of Model Y will cease to qualify for government subsidies.

news_headline: Foreign carmakers interested in India's Ford plant: Tamil Nadu Minister
news_article: Foreign carmakers have shown interest in acquiring Ford Motor Co's plant in Tamil Nadu, state Industries Minister Thangam Thenarasu said. He added that details of firms interested cannot be disclosed and "it is eventually up to Ford as it'll be a commercial arrangement". Tata Group also showed interest but the government is yet to hear from them, he said further.

news_headline: Sony plans to enter electric car market, says CEO
news_article: Japan's multinational conglomerate Sony Corporation plans to launch a new company named Sony Mobility to examine entering the electric vehicle market, said Sony's CEO Kenichiro Yoshida. ''With our imaging and sensing, cloud, 5G, and entertainment technologies combined with our contents mastery, we believe Sony is well positioned as a creative entertainment company to redefine mobility,'' he said.

news_headline: Volkswagen sells 70,600 ID EVs in China in 2021, misses target
news_article: German automaker Volkswagen sold 70,625 of its ID electric vehicles in China last year, missing its goal of selling 80,000 to 1,00,000 cars. The automaker said it would likely double sales of its ID battery electric vehicles in China this year. Volkswagen Group sold 3.3 million cars in China last year, a fall of 14% from 2020.

news_headline: Tesla delivers record 308,600 cars worldwide in 4th quarter of 2021
news_article: Tesla on Sunday said it delivered 308,000 electric cars worldwide in the fourth quarter of 2021, beating its previous single-quarter record. Tesla's total sales for the year stood at more than 936,000, up about 87% over 2020's deliveries of just under half a million vehicles. Notably, Tesla joined the exclusive club of companies with $1 trillion market value in 2021.

news_headline: NYC orders 184 Mustang Mach-Es for police, first responders, others
news_article: The New York City has ordered 184 fully electric Ford Mustang Mach-Es to be used by several city agencies, including the NYPD, first responders, and Department of Parks and Recreation. The vehicles are set to be delivered by June 2022, as part of a five-year, $11.5-million contract. The city is considering a different contract with Tesla for law enforcement.

news_headline: S Korea's SsangYong Motor sold for $254.6 million to local consortium
news_article: A consortium led by South Korean electric automaker Edison Motors has agreed to acquire SsangYong Motor for 305 billion won ($254.65 million), the latter said on Monday. This comes after SsangYong's sales fell to 84,496 units in 2021, about 21% lesser than its 2020 sales, as per a regulatory filing. Indian automaker Mahindra also owns about 75% stake in SsangYong.

news_headline: Tata Motors overtakes Hyundai as 2nd largest PV seller in Dec 2021
news_article: Tata Motors has overtaken Hyundai Motor India to become the second largest seller of passenger vehicles (PVs) in the domestic market for the first time in close to a decade in December 2021. Tata Motors registered sales of 35,299 PV units in December 2021, whereas Hyundai dispatched 32,312 units. Tata Motors said it dispatched close to 99,000 vehicles between October-December.

news_headline: BMW India sells 8,876 cars in 2021, sales surge by 34%
news_article: BMW India reported a year-on-year (YoY) growth of 34% with a dispatch of 8,876 units in 2021, recording the highest growth in a decade in India. The automaker dispatched 8,236 BMW and 640 Mini units last year compared to 6,604 units across BMW and Mini brands in 2020. The company generated over 40% sales from its locally assembled SAV range.

news_headline: Ford's e-scooter rental company Spin to fire 25% of its employees
news_article: Spin, the electric scooter rental company acquired by Ford Motor in 2018, will lay off 25% of its employees, as it pulls out of open permit markets. "We are offering affected employees severance packages and an additional stipend," Spin CEO Ben Bear said. The dynamics of open permit markets make it difficult to identify a path to profitability, he added.

news_headline: Ford Motor's vehicle sales in US fall by 6.8% in 2021
news_article: Automobile manufacturer Ford Motor reported a 6.8% fall in 2021 US vehicle sales as the company faced issues like lingering supply-chain bottlenecks and a global chip shortage. Ford sold a total of 19,05,955 vehicles in 2021, ending up behind Toyota Motor and General Motors. Ford sold 27,140 units of Mustang Mach-E electric crossover in 2021.

news_headline: Rolls-Royce car sales soar to highest in its 117-year history
news_article: Rolls-Royce on Monday announced that it created history last year selling the most cars it has ever sold in its 117-year history. The luxury carmaker sold 5,586 cars globally last year, up 49% from its sales in the same period in 2020. Sales of the brand's vehicles hit all-time records in most regions, including China and the US.

news_headline: 'Deltacron' COVID-19 infections combining Delta & Omicron found in Cyprus
news_article: A strain of COVID-19 that combines Delta and Omicron was found in Cyprus, according to Leondios Kostrikis, Professor of Biological Sciences at the University of Cyprus and Head of the Laboratory of Biotechnology and Molecular Virology. The discovery was named "Deltacron" due to the identification of Omicron-like genetic signatures within the Delta genomes, he said.

news_headline: Why were genes inserted in the pig before its heart was transplanted to a US man?
news_article: Six human genes were inserted into the genome of the donor pig to make the pig heart more tolerable to the human immune system before the organ was transplanted to a man in US. "Four genes were knocked out in the donor pig, including one to prevent excessive growth of the pig heart tissue," the doctors said.

news_headline: In a first, astronomers capture real-time death of star and supernova explosion
news_article: In a first, astronomers have imaged in real-time the death by explosion of a giant red star into Type II supernova. "It's like watching a ticking time bomb. We've never confirmed such violent activity in a dying red supergiant star where we see it produce such a luminous emission," said Raffaella Margutti, an Associate Professor of Astronomy at UC Berkeley.

news_headline: Remains of 180-million-year-old Britain's largest 'sea dragon' discovered, pic surfaces
news_article: The fossilised remains of Britain’s largest ‘sea dragon’ have been discovered at Rutland Water Nature Reserve. It is the biggest and most complete skeleton of its kind found to date in the UK, officials said. It is approximately 180 million years old with a skeleton measuring around 10 metres in length and a skull weighing approximately one tonne.

news_headline: Why was a pig's heart transplanted to a man in the US?
news_article: A pig's heart was transplanted to a US man as his condition — heart failure and an irregular heartbeat — made him ineligible for a human heart transplant or a heart pump. Doctors said, "There aren't enough donor human hearts available to meet long list of potential recipients." "This will provide new option for patients in the future," they added.

news_headline: Tallest volcano in Galápagos erupts, clouds of ash rise to 12,400 feet; pics surface
news_article: Wolf Volcano, the tallest mountain in the Galápagos islands, erupted, spewing lava down its flanks and clouds of ash over the Pacific Ocean, according to Ecuador’s Geophysical Institute. Clouds of ash from Wolf Volcano rose to over 12,400 feet above sea level after the eruption. The volcano had last erupted in 2015.

news_headline: Man in US gets genetically-modified pig heart in world-first transplant
news_article: David Bennett, a 57-year-old US man, has become the first person in the world to get a heart transplant from a genetically-modified pig. Bennett is doing well three days after the experimental seven-hour procedure in Baltimore, doctors said. Doctors had deemed him ineligible for a human transplant due to very poor health.

news_headline: Pebble-sized debris halts NASA's Perseverance Mars rover's sample collection
news_article: NASA’s Mars rover Perseverance’s rock sample collection has been obstructed after pebble-sized debris halted its functioning. On December 29, Perseverance successfully cored and extracted a sample from a Mars rock. However, fragments of the rock fell out of the sample tube during dropoff. On January 8, NASA tweeted images of the debris and said the issue is being worked on.

news_headline: Astronaut takes pic of Earth during spacewalk, says '2nd favourite view of Earth'
news_article: NASA astronaut Thomas H Marshburn has shared a photo of the Earth taken from space and wrote, "A candidate for the second favourite view of the Earth from space: the Caribbean Sea." He tweeted that it was captured during a spacewalk below the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency's external experiment platform.

news_headline: World's biggest, most powerful telescope fully deployed in space, says NASA
news_article: The James Webb Space Telescope, the world's largest and most powerful space telescope, completed its two-week-long deployment phase on Saturday, unfolding the final mirror panel, NASA said. "The final wing is now deployed," NASA tweeted. "Next up for Webb? Five months of alignment and calibration before we start getting images," it added.

news_headline: Air pollution caused 1.8 mn excess deaths globally in 2019: Study
news_article: Urban air pollution has caused 1.8 million excess deaths in several cities across the world in 2019, a study published in The Lancet Planetary Health journal stated. Between 2000-2019, PM2.5 concentrations and mortality trends associated with it were examined in over 13,000 cities by researchers and it was found that the PM2.5 concentrations exceeded seven times than WHO limits.

news_headline: Scientists name new tree after Leonardo DiCaprio as a tribute
news_article: Scientists at the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, have named a newly discovered tree after Leonardo DiCaprio. They wished to honour the actor for helping in saving an endangered forest where the tree only grows. "He was crucial in helping to stop the logging of the Ebo Forest," Dr Martin Cheek said. The tree has been officially named 'Uvariopsis dicaprio'.

news_headline: Going to space less scary than riding rollercoaster: Billionaire Yusaku
news_article: Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa, who spent 12 days on the International Space Station last month, said at a press conference that being launched into space was less scary than riding a rollercoaster. He added, "When you go into space, you become obsessed with the Earth." He added that the Earth looked a 100 times more beautiful from space than photographs.

news_headline: People will likely need a fourth COVID-19 vaccine shot: Moderna CEO
news_article: Moderna CEO Stephane Bancel said people would likely need to take the fourth dose of the COVID-19 vaccine as the efficacy of the booster dose wanes with time just like the first two shots. "I will be surprised when we get data...that it's holding nicely over time," Bancel said about the level of protection provided by the booster shots.

news_headline: Common cold T cells can protect against COVID-19, finds UK study
news_article: Researchers from Imperial College London found that immunity due to high levels of pre-existing T cells created by the human body during common colds protects against COVID-19. The scientists stated that T cells target internal proteins within the virus rather than the spike protein. T cells are a type of white blood cell that helps protect the body from infection.

news_headline: COVID vaccine targeting Omicron will be ready by March: Pfizer CEO
news_article: A vaccine targeting the Omicron variant of coronavirus will be ready by March this year, confirmed Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla on Monday. "We (are) already starting manufacturing some of these quantities at risk," he said. However, Bourla said he doesn't know if we would still need it. "I don't know if and how it will be used," he added.

news_headline: Biden administration's top official on environmental justice resigns
news_article: Senior Director for Environmental Justice at the US Council on Environmental Quality, Cecilia Martinez, has announced to step down. Martinez said that she needed time to rest and spend time with her family. This comes after Martinez played an instrumental role over the last year in helping disadvantaged communities as an integral part of President Joe Biden's environmental policies.

news_headline: China plans space station completion, over 40 launches in 2022
news_article: China will complete two modules of its under-construction space station and over 40 launches in 2022, the Xinhua News Agency reported on Thursday citing the China Aerospace Science and Technology Corporation (CASC). As per CASC, launches include two crewed missions and two cargo spacecraft. The CASC added that the Long March 6A rocket will make its maiden flight in 2022.

news_headline: Part of out-of-control Russian rocket crashes into sea after re-entry
news_article: A chunk of an out-of-control Russian Angara A5 spacecraft crashed into the sea near French Polynesia after it re-entered Earth's orbit on Wednesday, as per the data shared online. The rocket departed Earth on December 27, however, a second burn to move the spacecraft into a higher orbit failed, causing its upper part, Persei, to fall back on Earth.

news_headline: People with dementia in India will triple to 11.44 million by 2050: Report
news_article: Global Burden of Disease study published in The Lancet Public Health on Friday stated the number of people with dementia in India will triple to around 11.44 million by 2050. Factors like population growth, ageing, smoking, obesity, and lack of education of the subject might result in a 197% rise. As per 2019 records, 3.84 million Indians suffer from dementia.

news_headline: Sweden opens 7th International Office of Science in UK
news_article: Sweden has established its seventh International Office of Science and Innovation at its embassy in London last weekend. As per its statement, the office will develop and strengthen collaboration between the UK and Sweden over life sciences strategy and partnership programmes. It will help increase the visibility of higher education institutions, said Swedish Minister for Education Anna Ekström.

news_headline: Australian fossil site reveals its 15 mn year-old rainforest origins
news_article: A team of international archaeologists discovered the fossils of a "rich and abundant" rainforest from about 15 million years ago in New South Wales (NSW), Australia. The scientists found thousands of specimens of plants and animals from the site. "It is an extremely important site. It has everything that we hope for," said Matthew McCurry from the University of NSW.

news_headline: COVID-19 pandemic may affect infants' brains: US study
